question.body: Which of the following is correct?

multiple_choice.choice: Cardiac muscle cells rely on external calcium to create action potentials.
Skeletal muscle cells rely on external calcium to create action potentials.
Neural cells rely on external calcium to create action potentials.
None of these answers are correct.

response.feedback: Correct. One significant difference between the depolarization of cardiac muscle cells and other cells is their dependence on external calcium.
Incorrect. Skeletal muscle cells rely on sodium to create action potentials not calcium.
Incorrect. Neural cells rely on sodium to create action potentials not calcium.
Incorrect. Skeletal muscle and neural cells rely on sodium to create action potentials, but cardiac muscle relies on external calcium.
